column5: Hey, just curious if any fellow anglers have ever tried a smaller version of the senko style baits for Brookies? I hear surveys that have been done and revealed that trout do seem to readily eat these baits, so just figured that maybe a smaller version, like say 3" or so would be an effective bait?
Brookies are pretty dumb when  they are hungry.   But it wouldn't be my first choice of baits

I have tried 3" senkos for brookies and splake. They will hit them, but are tough to hook up because of their tendency to slash a lure. In the plastics department, I have had way more luck using small swimbaits.
I've never tried, but I assume any fish that would take a worm would take one of these too. I would agree with singingdog here about tough hookups though.
Okay,thanks guys..yah, it wouldn't be my first choice either, but just figured sometimes something "off the wall" can work wonders!
Haven't caught much trout, but I think small pink worms are the best.

Brookies are pretty dumb when they are hungry. But it wouldn't be my first choice of baits  Agreed, I wouldn't waste my time with a slow presentation like that for specs.   Spinners tipped with a piece of worm, spoons, small cranks, etc.
I have had great luck for Lakers with senkos in the past.
